intro: Coniogramme parvipinnula, commonly known as the small-pinnate coniogramme, is a species of flowering plant in the family Araliaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, particularly Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant features compound leaves with small, closely spaced leaflets, giving it a delicate, fern-like appearance. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in umbels. Coniogramme parvipinnula is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and ease of care.
